intro: Calvoa calliantha, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is a low-growing cactus with a distinctive appearance, featuring a compact stem covered in dense, spiny areoles. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Its adaptations to harsh desert conditions include succulent stems that store water and reduced leaves to minimize water loss. Calvoa calliantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry environments.
